reviews.text: Terrific hotel, very reasonably priced for the quality of rooms and service. The building is somewhat nondescript and can be difficult to find. Take the Yaesu exit, carry a map or ask someone. Large rooms by Tokyo standards, well-furnished and spotlessly clean. Free internet.
reviews.title: Excellent rooms and service, close to Tokyo Station

reviews.text: Breakfast was only Japanese style and fairly expensive (2500 yen), but there are enough cafes and restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised and will definitely stay here for next visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't be beat for the price and location.
reviews.title: 2 blocks from Tokyo central station

reviews.text: During my stay in late March (4D 3N) we were greeted by the English speaking staff at reception and they were very helpful when we booked our airport coach buses the next day, you'll need to pop into the Family Mart next store to complete the process of getting the tickets though. The pick up/drop off bus stop being right at the entrance of the hotel made things much easier for us. Take note the bus ride to and fro is 1 hour and you should purchase your ticket 2 days in advance to make sure you don't need to standby for seats.
reviews.title: Convenience and reasonable

reviews.text: The standard room we stayed (double bed, I wasn't sure if the twin bed rooms were full) was sufficiently sized and enough for us to open our large suitcases. The bathroom was amply sized with a bathtub and I cannot rave enough about the hairdryer. Was considering to buy one home but the transformer was a concern for usage in HK. It dried my long hair at least half the time it would take were I to dry with my own hair dryer. Soft fluffy slippers eased my sore feet at the end of the day.
reviews.title: Excellent location - extremely clean rooms

reviews.text: This hotel, perfectly located, is just down the block from Tokyo Station and has flawlessly executed rooms that are certainly large enough, by Tokyo standards. GREAT beds. Quiet, clean, spotless. The price ideal.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: I think this is a superb find.
reviews.title: Fantastic Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I left a cashmere blazer in the closet and they tracked me down at my next to hotel. Extraordinary.
reviews.title: Fine, but the breakfast?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night here as we arrived in Tokyo. The staff were very helpful, spoke excellent English and did all they could to make sure our arrival in Japan was as easy as possible. The proximity to Tokyo station was especially convenient if you need to use the Shinkansen.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room, bed, and bathroom were perfectly fine. The location, for us as first-time visitors, was great. In five days, we must have spent four hours in Tokyo Station, just 3 minutes away and a city in itself. We had made plans to meet our local guide (a great free service, by the way--Google it) for breakfast our first morning there. Until you have seen an all-Japanese buffet you have no idea how different our cuisines are. We love Japanese food, but not for breakfast. And at $80 for three, eating eel at 7:00am was no bargain.
reviews.title: Want to be by Tokyo Station? STAY HERE!!!
Staff and location fantastic
reviews.text: Other than a small hiccup at check in, this was an excellent hotel. We booked a triple room (which was a twin with an extra bed) and we had plenty of space even with a cot in the room as well. Take care to book a triple for three people (apparently this is not assumed when paying extra for a triple). The woman that checked us in was quite surly, an anomaly in Japan I found, but the rest of the staff were outstanding. I left something at our previous hotel that they organised to get to me overnight at a very reasonable price, and one staff member even walked with my 4 year old son to the post box at 9pm (it was outside the hotel and down the street a little) as he didn't understand that they would send his postcards for him- so lovely.

The hotel is in a great location, a few blocks from the mammoth Tokyo station, which has food options that would take a year to sample. It is walking distance from the shopping district of Ginza and there is an airport bus for Narita outside and one for Haneda down the road. There is also a convenience store next door. There is a laundry room in the hotel which is a godsend when travelling with little children!
reviews.title: Cannot Say Enough Good Things
Really worth the money you are paying
reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel if it is in your budget. It has a lovely feel to it, the rooms are really nice and the toiletries were excellent - my aching body appreciated the bath soaks each night after walking all day! All in all, a great end to our trip to Japan.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Awesome hotel. The location can't be beat. You're just down the street from Tokyo Station, a major transportation hub. The area around you has plenty of restaurants, shopping, etc.
reviews.title: Tokyo experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a hotel that has thought of all the little things. I stayed in the cheapest room they had, but I still had slippers, coffee and tea every morning, and a wide range of toiletries. They also included origami paper and a free postcard which they mail and pay the postage for. It's the little touches like that that make this hotel awesome.
reviews.title: Fantastic and convenient

reviews.text: Location ! Location ! Location ! This hotel is so handy when moving around in Tokyo. Staff are very helpful, and rooms are very clean and updatd ! We have been staying here for every trips we did in Tokyo.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Tokyo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is ll worth the hype and rightfully deserve its 5 star excellence! Check in and out is a whizz away, security is top notch with only your key card that could access that level.
reviews.title: Well situated & newly refurbish with all the amenities

reviews.text: Room is bigger than the usual Tokyo hotel rooms, comfortable with more than an average amenities one can desire, from hair dryer to wi-fi to green tea. You name it, there have it. (Even tv speaker in the toilet!). Bed is one of the most comfortable you could find.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is also well situated in Tokyo with jr Tokyo station just 3mins walk away, and bus stop just a couple of blocks away, both with transport access to and from the airport. Staff is well equipped with English language as well.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in the centre of Tokyo

reviews.text: If you are going in the Sakura blooming season, you could even catch the blooming on the next street as well.
reviews.title: So much to like about Ryumeikan including its value
